defaultText.description: Additional evaluation considerations, for example, if you require that the student's response is simplified, or meets a specific tolerance, or should be literally matched...

isSimplified.description: Less complicated form, for example the common factors removed and like terms grouped.

isMixedFraction.description: Form of an integer followed by a fractional part.

isImproperFraction.description: Entry needs to be of the form of a/b where a>b

isRationalized.description: There should not be any roots in the denominator.

isFactorised.description: Split into a product of simpler expressions. The opposite of Expanded.

isExpanded.description: Multiplied to remove parenthesis. The opposite of factored.

isExponentialForm.description: Written as base with power of the number of repeats.

tolerance.description: Student answer is accetable if within this range. Can also use \% sign.

requireIntervalNotation.description: Range of real numbers, enclosed by rounded or square parenthesis.

numberType.description: Defines of a specific amount of something.

integerType.description: A number that can be written without a fractional component.

isDecimal.description: A whole number and a fractional part separated by a decimal point.

scientificType.description: Way to write a very large or small number using powers of ten.

significantDecimalPlaces.description: A number expressed with sufficient digits that express the required precision.

isIn.description: Student's answer needs to lie within a specified interval or set. Enter the number of unique items the student needs to returm.
isIn.description1: If the student needs to return 2 numbers, then a possible valid answer would be 0.35,0.45

satisfies.description: Student's answer needs to meet the given in/equality or equation. Enter the number of items that the students needs to return.
satisfies.description1: If the student needs to return 2 numbers, then a possible valid answer would be 3,4

compareSides.description: This is often used in a CLOZE question type where there are connected entries separated by an in/equality. The evaluation separately considers both sides, e.g. “LHS=LHS & RHS=RHS”. Note that prior to evaluation, the sense of the inequality will be aligned between the student's response and the expected answer.

isParabolaVertexForm.description: y = a(x - h)^2 + k ( x or y can be on LHS)

setDecimalSeparator.description: The separator of the decimal part of a number. The default is a dot.

setThousandsSeparator.description: Separator of the thousands part of a number. The default is a comma.

interpretAsInterval.description: This handles the case when the expected answer is specified as an interval, but the student neglects to include the surrounding parenthesis. This may also help in some cases where the entry is a x,y coordinate, a vector, a set, or a list. Note that you can also use parenthesis for the appropriate form, e.g. {0,1,2,3} is a set, [0,1,2] is a list, <0,1> is a vector, and (-10,0) is a coordinate point. For intervals such as (a,b), a must be less than b. Use rounded parenthesis for not including the ends, or square parenthesis for inclusion, e.g. [0,1].
interpretAsInterval.description1: If the student enters 0,1 then this will be considered as correct.

complexType.description: A combination of a real and an imaginary number in the form a + bi. This option is needed when the evaluation can handle complex evaluations.

interpretAsSet.description: A collection of distinct objects separated by commas. Order is not considered.

interpretAsList.description: An ordered set of distinct objects separated by commas.

allowEulersNumber.description: Any "e" in an expression will be interpreted as the same as the exponential function.

interpretTrigArgAsDegree.description: Trigonometric function arguments are treated as degrees. The default is radians.

interpretAsImaginary.description: Interprets "i" as the square root of -1.

ignoreCase.description: Less complicated form, for example the common factors removed and like terms grouped.

allowedVariables.description: Students can only use the list of variables that are specified.

allowNumericOnly.description: Students can only enter numbers in the entry box.

ignoreAlphabeticCharacters.description: Any alphabetic characters in the response will be ignored.

allowedUnits.description: Students can only use these units. Equivalence between common units is considered.

interpretAsNumber.description: A combination of a real and an imaginary number in the form a + bi. This option is needed when the evaluation can handle complex evaluations.

applyRule.description: These rules only check the form of the answer. For example you can check if the student's entry is written a decimal with 2 decimal places.
